messages.message:
Hey team, Here’s an update regarding the feedback provided by @mfichman.
The issues mentioned were caused by scanning files that weren’t part of the services, such as test and generated files for Procto. To address this, we’ve updated our global configuration with the appropriate exclusion and inclusion properties. You can find the relevant PR below.
Regarding code coverage, we’ve modified our quality check to run over the entire codebase instead of just new code. This can be adjusted later, as we are still in the trial phase.

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67758
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67812
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67758
@Parvez Q: How is coverage collected? From pre-merge unit tests, or some other source?

There are 2 ways to configure code coverage
1. *Running code coverage on new PR*: This will only scans the modified files and check if corresponding test cases have been added. This is currently disable in our system.
2. *Running code coverage on master*: On every scan of the base repository code coverage is calculated. This is set to 60% in our new configuration. 
Drawbacks:
• Right now there is no way for us to define different checks for a single project
• We are considering dividing our whole repo into multiple project, this will give us the ability to add different quality gates.
